definition[0]: an elective position or organization is one for which there is an election
example[0]: the 34 elective seats in the National Assembly
definition[1]: elective medical treatment is treatment that you choose to have, although you do not have to
example[1]: elective surgery such as hip replacements
definition[2]: an elective course is one that students can choose to take, although they do not have to take it in order to graduate
definition[3]: a course that students can choose to take, but they do not have to take it in order to graduate
